FIELD.NAME: id
FIELD.COMMENT: id of the table, please edit me

FIELD.NAME: course
FIELD.COMMENT: Course ID

FIELD.NAME: name
FIELD.COMMENT: Name of wiki

FIELD.NAME: subwikis
FIELD.COMMENT: 0=single subwiki (no groups), 1=per-group subwikis, 2=per-user subwikis

FIELD.NAME: timeout
FIELD.COMMENT: How long users are allowed to edit, in seconds, before it automatically saves their changes and ends the edit. Null = no timeout.

FIELD.NAME: template
FIELD.COMMENT: Null for no template, or set to a filename (name only, no path). File will be opened from mod_data/ouwiki and used to initialise the content of all new subwikis.

FIELD.NAME: intro
FIELD.COMMENT: Optional non-editable text that displays above the edit field on the start page to describe the purpose of the wiki.

FIELD.NAME: editbegin
FIELD.COMMENT: Date in seconds since epoch, or null. If set, the wiki is in read-only mode (i.e. even users who have mod/ouwiki:edit cannot actually edit anything) until the specified date.

FIELD.NAME: editend
FIELD.COMMENT: Date in seconds since epoch, or null. If set, the wiki is in read-only mode (i.e. even users who have mod/ouwiki:edit cannot actually edit anything) from the specified date onwards.

FIELD.NAME: completionpages
FIELD.COMMENT: If set, wiki should be marked complete once user creates this many new pages of their own.

FIELD.NAME: completionedits
FIELD.COMMENT: If set, wiki should be marked complete once user makes this many edits to the wiki.

FIELD.NAME: annotation
FIELD.COMMENT: If set, wiki will use annotations.

FIELD.NAME: allowimport
FIELD.COMMENT: Shows whether the link to import pages is displayed within the wiki activity.

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: Time (in seconds since epoch).

INDEX.NAME: ouwiki_ix_course
INDEX.COMMENT: So we can find all wikis for a course if we want.

TABLE.NAME: ouwiki_subwikis
TABLE.COMMENT: Contains a row for each subwiki. A subwiki is an independent collection of named pages. For example, when a wiki is set to group mode, each group has their own subwiki.

FIELD.NAME: id
FIELD.COMMENT: id of the table, please edit me

FIELD.NAME: wikiid
FIELD.COMMENT: Wiki that owns this subwiki

FIELD.NAME: groupid
FIELD.COMMENT: Null if not a group subwiki. References the group in mdl_groups that this subwiki is for.

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: Null if not a user subwiki. References the user in mdl_user that this subwiki is for.

FIELD.NAME: magic
FIELD.COMMENT: Magic code used to provide a degree of access security for the RSS feeds, i.e. make it impossible to guess the URLs.

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the table, please edit me

INDEX.NAME: ouwiki_subwikis_unique_group
INDEX.COMMENT: Make sure only one group subwiki per wikiid

INDEX.NAME: ouwiki_subwikis_unique_user
INDEX.COMMENT: Make sure only one user subwiki per wikiid

TABLE.NAME: ouwiki_pages
TABLE.COMMENT: Single pages inside a subwiki. If a page has multiple versions, it still has only one entry in this table.

FIELD.NAME: id
FIELD.COMMENT: id of the table, please edit me

FIELD.NAME: subwikiid
FIELD.COMMENT: The subwiki that owns this page.

FIELD.NAME: title
FIELD.COMMENT: Title for the page. All pages must have a title, but the start page for the wiki is set to empty string.

FIELD.NAME: currentversionid
FIELD.COMMENT: Points to the most recent entry in ouwiki_versions. This is the entry that will appear when viewing the page normally. May be null if there are no versions of the page yet.

FIELD.NAME: locked
FIELD.COMMENT: Allows the page to be locked. Introduced with the Annotations commenting system to allow page locking while editing annotations.

FIELD.NAME: firstversionid
FIELD.COMMENT: Points to the entry in ouwiki_versions that first related to this page. This is used for participation calculations to help with query load at that point.

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the table, please edit me

TABLE.NAME: ouwiki_versions
TABLE.COMMENT: Each row here is a version of the content on a particular subwiki page. Whenever a change is saved, a new version is created.

FIELD.NAME: id
FIELD.COMMENT: id of the table, please edit me

FIELD.NAME: pageid
FIELD.COMMENT: Page that this is a version of.

FIELD.NAME: xhtml
FIELD.COMMENT: Contains actual XHTML content of the page. Should be well-formed XML (when placed inside a containing element).

FIELD.NAME: timecreated
FIELD.COMMENT: Time (seconds since epoch) at which the version was created.

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: User who created this version. May be null if the version was created by the system, such as when the wiki is initialised from a template.

FIELD.NAME: changestart
FIELD.COMMENT: If a section was edited, set to the starting point (in bytes) of the section within the 'xhtml' field. If the whole page was edited, set to null.

FIELD.NAME: changesize
FIELD.COMMENT: If a section was edited, the new size of the section in bytes. Otherwise null.

FIELD.NAME: changeprevsize
FIELD.COMMENT: If a section was edited, the previous size of the section (before editing) in bytes. Otherwise null.

FIELD.NAME: deletedat
FIELD.COMMENT: timestamp when page version was deleted

FIELD.NAME: previousversionid
FIELD.COMMENT: Points to the entry in ouwiki_versions of the previous version for the page. This is used for participation calculations to help with query load at that point.

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the table, please edit me

TABLE.NAME: ouwiki_links
TABLE.COMMENT: Keeps record of all wiki-links (links within the wiki that were specified using square brackets, in the topageid or tomissingpage fields) and standard URL links or images (in the tourl field).

FIELD.NAME: id
FIELD.COMMENT: id of the table, please edit me

FIELD.NAME: fromversionid
FIELD.COMMENT: Version that contains this link.

FIELD.NAME: topageid
FIELD.COMMENT: Target of the link. Must be specified unless the target doesn't exist yet.

FIELD.NAME: tomissingpage
FIELD.COMMENT: If link goes to a page that doesn't exist, includes name of missing page. Should be filled in (set this field to null, set topageid) once page is created.

FIELD.NAME: tourl
FIELD.COMMENT: When page links to a URL that is recorded here.

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the table, please edit me

TABLE.NAME: ouwiki_locks
TABLE.COMMENT: When people are editing a subwiki page or section, that information is stored in this table so that other people cannot edit the same thing at the same time.

FIELD.NAME: id
FIELD.COMMENT: id of the table, please edit me

FIELD.NAME: pageid
FIELD.COMMENT: Page being edited

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: Moodle user who holds this lock.

FIELD.NAME: versionid
FIELD.COMMENT: Null if whole page is locked. If a section is locked, this is the version that they started off by editing.

FIELD.NAME: sectionstart
FIELD.COMMENT: Null if whole page is locked. If section is locked, this is the start position in bytes relative to the beginning of the 'xhtml' field in the specified version.

FIELD.NAME: sectionsize
FIELD.COMMENT: Null if whole page is locked. If section is locked, this is the size of the section being edited in bytes.

FIELD.NAME: lockedat
FIELD.COMMENT: Time (seconds since epoch) at which lock was first seen.

FIELD.NAME: expiresat
FIELD.COMMENT: Time (seconds since epoch) at which lock expires. Null if there is no expiry. (This is a hard lock that occurs about 1 minute after the user-visible timeout.)

FIELD.NAME: seenat
FIELD.COMMENT: Time (seconds since epoch) at which the user's client checked in to confirm they still hold the lock. Locks become invalid a certain time after this, in addition to the fixed expiry time.

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the table, please edit me

TABLE.NAME: ouwiki_sections
TABLE.COMMENT: Stores reference to sections (marked by headings) within pages. Entries in this table are only added when sections are actually used to store something in the database. They may remain after the section itself has been deleted from the current page version.

FIELD.NAME: id
FIELD.COMMENT: id of the table, please edit me

FIELD.NAME: pageid
FIELD.COMMENT: ID of page that this section is for.

FIELD.NAME: xhtmlid
FIELD.COMMENT: This is the ID used in XHTML for the section, excluding prefix. For example if the heading is <h2 id="ouwiki_41_325"> then this value will be 41_325. When storing data for the main part of a page rather than a subsection, this should be set to null.

FIELD.NAME: title
FIELD.COMMENT: Title of section in plain text (no HTML), restricted to a reasonable length. The title is taken from the contents of the heading tag in HTML and is updated when the page is saved. ('Dead' sections retain their title in the database.)

KEY.NAME: primary
KEY.COMMENT: primary key of the table, please edit me

TABLE.NAME: ouwiki_annotations
TABLE.COMMENT: Holds the inline comments for the commenting system called Annotations.

FIELD.NAME: pageid
FIELD.COMMENT: used to get all all annotations on a page

FIELD.NAME: userid
FIELD.COMMENT: who created the annotation

FIELD.NAME: timemodified
FIELD.COMMENT: Time the annotation was created or edited

FIELD.NAME: content
FIELD.COMMENT: Annotation text, plain text not HTML
